data.title: Fix to have units avoid friendly fire from projectiles.
data.body: Added new trait ScatterFromProjectiles to allow units to scatter away from projectiles from allies (and self).

data.title: Allies 01 SP mission
data.body:
Includes SP map allies-01.oramap and Missions/Allies01Script.cs.

Allies 01 is an OpenRA remake of Red Alert's first Allied SP mission, with a few additions/changes.
It will likely be the first mission of an OpenRA campaign based on the original RA campaign.

Video of the original mission: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fCMOfA9pWv8

data.title: Fix to have units avoid projectile friendly fire.
data.body: When I control one massive group comprising of both long-range artillery and short-range infantry, I find that the infantry is quite suicidal by default and is not interested in self-preservation against friendly-fire from the artillery who are all attacking the same target. This patch attempts to resolve that by having the friendly-firing unit notify other units near the destination point of the projectile. Their reaction is to move the shortest distance away from ground-zero to relative safety, depending on how large the blast radius of the projectile is.

data.title: Fixed broken Install from CD code in RA.
data.body: RA Install from CD option was crashing due to `"continueLoading"` missing from `args`.

data.title: Improvements to Harvester AI.
data.body:
A harvester will now claim a resource on the map it has decided to harvest so that other harvesters do not attempt to harvest it. Enemy/neutral harvester claims are not respected but allied claims are respected.
A harvester will now search for resources near the last harvested cell instead of blindly moving there first (and potentially discovering that there is nothing there to collect).

data.title: RA: Harvester logic improvements
data.body:
A harvester will now claim a resource on the map it has decided to harvest so that other harvesters do not attempt to harvest it.
A harvester will now search for resources near the last harvested cell instead of blindly moving there first (and potentially discovering that there is nothing there to collect).

data.title: Fixed settings related crashes/lockups in cnc and d2k and cnc palette issues.
data.body: I tested bleed recently and the recent Red Alert settings additions (Cash Ticks, Renderer, UPnP) break things in the other mods. This commit fixes everything. Making the cursor transparent (for Dune 2000) does not look good for Tiberian Dawn so I added an exception.

data.title: [cnc] Infantry can now get into the hospital to seek medical care
data.body: Fixes #2228 without touching the source-code. It also makes sense that they have to visit the hospital and not enter some kind of magic heal zone. Well, they don't really enter as there is no "-BelowUnits:" nor "AboveUnits:", but this way you can see that they get healed.

data.title: [d2k] incompatible infantry frame order
data.body:
Note to self: use the new OpenRA.Utility.exe --transpose command to fix Dune 2000 infantry "dancing bug" when shooting:

```
[01:38] <chrisf|work> say there are 10 frames, and 8 facings, and the first frame is at offset 24 in the SHP
[01:38] <chrisf|work> then `--transpose foo.shp bar.shp 24 10 8` will switch that block between ra and d2k styles
```

data.title: [cnc] Hospital does nothing after capture
data.body: I tried to make it a healer, but that does not work (updated documentation). As a workaround it could allow the training of medics or ambulances. Maybe a helicopter medivac? Someone would need to draw a icon and/or SHP for that. Allowing auto-healing within a range-circle would be the easiest solution.

data.title: [cnc] Can't build visceroid after Biolab capture
data.body: Map East vs West 3 features a neutral Biolab that can be captured (after the towers are destroyed). However I can't build visceroids then. They are greyed out (requires: Biolab). If I activate the cheat "build everything" I can train them. They are properly scripted fully functional units.

data.title: added Renderer DropDown in RA Settings
data.body: This fixes issue #2052 and should help with the number 1 newbie question what to do when graphical glitches appear.

data.title: Add Einstein
data.body: Einstein needs to be set up so I can use him for my Allies 01 mission. The voices and SHP are already there.

data.title: [d2k] SmudgeLayer needs support for TerrainType
data.body: Dune 2000 has different craters that depend on the terrain which can be either rock or sand.

data.title: Latest updates from the Dune 2000 mod
data.body: These are mostly tileset and infantry related. It also adds the auto-downloader and the first real map.

data.title: 2 maps: Bomber John(minigame->new); Free Coasts(conquest->replace)
[d2k] cursor.yaml palette does not support shadows
data.body:
There are two ways to define the mouse pointer palette:

cursor.yaml:

```
Palettes:
    cursor: cursor.pal
```

This works all the time, but has no shadow color defined.

system.yaml:

```
    PaletteFromFile@d2k:
        Name: d2k
        Filename: d2k.pal
```

If cursor.yaml referes to this definition it gets proper transparency. However it does not find the palette when the installer chrome is loaded (and system.yaml is not). You also can't set both as it will result in "already defined" error.

data.title: Changing the shadow color does not work
data.body: I tried to edit the A: value at https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/blob/dune/mods/d2k/rules/system.yaml#L133 to make the shadows brighter as in the original Dune 2000. Changing the value had no effect at all.

data.title: PaletteFormat relies on hardcoded data
data.body:
PlayerColorPalette:PaletteFormat would be a lot more customizable if it just listed the 16 (or, any number of) indices used for remap on the palette, from bright to dark colours. To convert the current enums, the values would become:

ra: 80,81,82,83,84,85,86,87,88,89,90,91,92,93,94,95
cnc: 176,177,184,178,185,179,186,180,187,188,189,181,190,191,182,183
d2k: 255,254,253,252,251,250,249,248,247,246,245,244,243,242,241,240

I suggest using a name like RemapIndices or something like that

data.body:
Having two lines for this everywhere is horrible

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/98209-convert-x-y-yaml-chrome-fields-into-a-single-field-with-two-parts?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Get rid of CursorSequence duplication
data.body:
This duplicates a bunch of things from Sequence, for no good reason.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/98211-get-rid-of-cursorsequence-duplication?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: InstallShield setup.z extractor fails for Dune 2000
data.body: The Dune 2000 CD also has a setup/setup.z which I can unpack with http://legroom.net/software/uniextract using a closed-source i3comp.exe (Stirling Technologies, Freeware). All the game data except the music is included in this InstallShield 3.0 archive. To get the CD ripper working the InstallUtils need to be updated. I found some documentation on the format at https://github.com/ahnurmi/openiw/wiki/InstallShield-v3 There seems to be an Open Source tool named STIX written in Assembly, Object Pascal and German for decompression. Well I could help with the last two languages a bit. The author also packed the code in an old DOS archive format called ARJ which I can't open so I gave up here.

data.title: [d2k] completely different shroud tiles in Dune 2000
data.body: I don't know how to solve this easily. I think this is the Dune 2000 shroud http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=units&id=164 However the tiles look completely different in order (this could be fixed) shape and palette. It will show awful yellow/blue distortions without proper shadow (keeps bright) when I use them so I currently fallback on the RA shadow.shp which is 24x24 and has gaps when used on 32x32 tile-size terrain.

data.title: [d2k] allow different announcer voices for each faction
data.body: Dune 2000 has different announcer (EVA) voices for each faction "harvester under attack", "low power", "new construction options". Currently I can only set them in system.yaml not in voices.yaml separate for each faction.

data.title: [d2k] PlayerColorPalette has problems fading the team color
data.body: The OpenRA palette modifier breaks things a little bit. Have a look at the screenshot at http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=units&id=160 It compares OpenRA d2k mod (left) with Dune 2000 (right). The white parts are black or transparent and the fading effect is not understood at all. You can see that the orange player colors are the source of the problem when comparing with the SHP render.

data.title: [d2k] RenderBuildingTurreted does not support separate turret sequence
data.body: Dune 2000 turrets use a base (that can be attached on/to walls, but that may be another issue) and a separate turret (different for each faction). RenderBuildingTurreted does not support that so currently the Dune 2000 turrets only consist of the base without turret. Shooting works already. The RA/CnC turrets do not use any overlay feature (every frame shows the complete turret in another direction).

data.title: generic overlay feature for SHPs
data.body:
Dune 2000 sometimes combines different SHPs:
- structures appear before the make animation is complete
- burning structures
- welding in factories
- windtrap lighting up
- chimney smoke for refinery
- radar dish turning around
- construction yard crane
- sandworm eating stuff consists of mouth and separate surrounding sand
- harvest animation (sand is spit out)

I think this needs a source code update to make it possible with OpenRA. Some structures consist of two parts (factories, refinery) which I currently put together using RenderWeaponFactory: and Length: 1 so it should be possible.

data.title: Shellmap Music Loops throughout the entire game.
data.body: Currently, the shellmap music, if enabled, loops throughout the entire game. This should not be the case. When a player enters the game lobby, the music should have the option to switch to something else. And when the game actually starts, it should start the normal music mixer.

data.title: Make ProductionAirdrop delivery unit configurable
data.body: Currently this is hardcoded to `c17`. It should be configurable in yaml.
